strings.Value: "What is it?"
"Looks strange."
"What does it have to do with me?"
"Maybe you should show the potion to an alchemist first?"
"That potion might be dangerous."
"Of course it is!"
"Please, don't risk your life."
"No! I forbid it!"
"If it restores your beauty, it's worth the risk!"
"It's dangerous! Please, throw that muck away and don't risk yourself!"
"Don't even think about using that suspicious potion!"
"It's up to you to decide what to do."
{n}Valerie shows you a small vial of light-purple liquid.{/n} "Look what I got in the city."
"I just wanted to see what you think." {n}Valerie holds the vial to the light and studies its contents with apparent indifference.{/n}

"This is an alchemical potion, some sort of cure-all in a vial. I don't know what's in it, but the vendor promised it would make my scar disappear if I take it five times." {n}Valerie looks at you steadily.{/n} "I had a moment of weakness and bought the potion... but now I'm not so sure if using it is such a good idea."
"I don't think a different specialist would say anything definite. Besides, most alchemists I spoke to said the scar is magical, so simple potions won't help."

"Who knows, maybe they're all right, and the vendor tricked me. Or maybe everyone else I talked to were amateurs, and I finally managed to find the only worthy alchemist in the entire {g|Stolen Lands}Stolen Lands{/g}."
{n}Valerie squints one eye.{/n} "It might also take this mark off my face. Do you think it's worth it? Taking a risk to restore my beauty?"

{n}Disappointment flickers in Valerie's eyes.{/n} "Is that so... Beauty is worth going blind. Or growing scales all over my body. Well, thanks for your answer." {n}Valerie steps aside, fiddles with the vial in her hands... and then hurls it away.{/n}

{n}Valerie looks at you with, puzzled or perhaps annoyed.{/n} "Don't you think such an order is beyond the scope of my service?" {n}Valerie turns around and steps away, then casually throws the vial into the bushes.{/n}
{n}Valerie's eyes grow warmer.{/n} "Very good. I'm sorry I distracted you for such a foolish reason." {n}Valerie throws the vial over her shoulder without looking.{/n}

"Indeed. I don't know why I came to you." {n}Valerie's eyes grow warmer. She weighs the vial in her hands.{/n} "I don't think I'll risk life and limb for such a trifle." {n}Valerie then throws the vial aside.{/n}
